content.text:
# Kincheng Banking Corporation

Kincheng Banking Corporation or Kincheng Bank () was a bank in Hong Kong. It was established in Tianjin in 1917 by Zhou Zuomin (, a native of Huai'an in Jiangsu), Ni Sichong (, Anhui General Commander) and Wang Zhilong (, Ni's treasurer). Kincheng Banking Corporation, Yien Yieh Commercial Bank, Continental Bank and China & South Sea Bank were called "Four Northern Banks" in 1920s in China.
In 1952, it was grouped into the Joint Office of Joint Public-Private Banks with 8 other Chinese banks. In 2001, it was merged to form Bank of China (Hong Kong).
